lead_paragraph: The Admiral Kuznetsov, a Soviet-era aircraft carrier prone to accidents, steamed through the English Channel in the Kremlin’s latest effort to reassert itself as a maritime power.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ivan Nechepurenko and Oleg Matsnev from Moscow, and Steven Erlanger and Pauline Bock from London.

headline.print_headline: Russian Carrier, Menacing but a Bit Rickety, Is Bound for Syria
headline.main: Russian Carrier Is Bound for Syria, Flexing Muscle but Risking Malfunction

snippet: The Admiral Kuznetsov, a Soviet-era aircraft carrier prone to accidents, steamed through the English Channel in the Kremlin’s latest effort to reassert itself as a maritime power....
abstract: Admiral Kuznetsov, Russia's lone aircraft carrier, travels through English Channel en route to Syria, where it is expected to backup military operations of Pres Bashar al-Assad in October; mission will represent carrier's first use since Cold War, as well as attempt by Russia to reassert its naval might.
